official_title: To require that employers offering benefits to associates of its employees who are not spouses or dependents of the employees not discriminate on the basis of the nature of the relationship between the employee and the designated associates.
short_title: Nondiscrimination in Employee Benefits Act of 1997
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Nondiscrimination in Employee Benefits Act of 1997 - Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to declare that, when an employer elects to offer benefits to associates of its employees who are not their spouses or dependents, the employer shall do so on a nondiscriminatory basis without regard to the nature of the relationship between the employee and the designated associate.

titles.title: Nondiscrimination in Employee Benefits Act of 1997

To require that employers offering benefits to associates of its employees who are not spouses or dependents of the employees not discriminate on the basis of the nature of the relationship between the employee and the designated associates.
